info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Grant, Blackford and western Jay Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 614 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Matthews, or near Upland, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Hartford City around 620 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Dunkirk, Redkey and Pennville. This includes Interstate 69 in Indiana between mile markers 252 and 259. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
